text.p: If a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] contains [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_4[/mathjaxinline] as a subspace, what is the smallest possible dimension of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: We have shown that the dimension of a subspace can be at most equal to the dimension of the space it is contained in. Note that [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] could equal [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P}_4[/mathjaxinline], which would give us [mathjaxinline]\dim V = 5[/mathjaxinline].
